BiblioData.Title: METHODS AND MATERIALS FOR FABRICATING LAMINATE NANOMOLDS AND NANOPARTICLES THEREFROM
BiblioData.Abstract: A laminate nanomold includes a layer of perfluoropolyether defining a cavity that has a predetermined shape and a support layer coupled with the layer of perfluoropolyether. The laminate can also include a tie-layer coupling the layer of perfluoropolyether with the support layer. The tie-layer can also include a photocurable component and a thermal curable component. The cavity can have a broadest dimension of less than 500 nanometers.

Claims.P: 1. A laminate nanomold; comprising:
a layer of perfluoropolyether, wherein the layer of perfluoropolyether defines a cavity having a predetermined shape; and
a support layer coupled with the layer of perfluoropolyether.
2. The laminate of claim 1, further comprising a tie-layer coupling the layer of perfluoropolyether with the support layer.
3. The laminate of claim 2, wherein the tie-layer comprises a dual cure material.
4. The laminate of claim 1, further comprising a plurality of cavities defined in the perfluoropolyether layer.

5. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities comprise a predetermined shape selected from the group consisting of cylindrical, 200 nm diameter cylinders, cuboidal, 200 nm cuboidal, crescent, and concave disc.
6. The laminate of claim 4, wherein the plurality of cavities comprise cavities of a variety of predetermined shapes.
7. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 10 micrometers in a largest dimension.
8. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 5 micrometers in a largest dimension.
9. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 1 micrometers in a largest dimension.
10. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 750 nanometers in a largest dimension.
11. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 500 nanometers in a largest dimension.
12. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 300 nanometers in a largest dimension.
13. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 200 nanometers in a largest dimension.
14. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 100 nanometers in a largest dimension.
15. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 75 nanometers in a largest dimension.
16. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 50 nanometers in a largest dimension.
17. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 40 nanometers in a largest dimension.
18. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 30 nanometers in a largest dimension.
19. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 20 nanometers in a largest dimension.
20. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 10 nanometers in a largest dimension.
21. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 50 micrometers thick.
22. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 40 micrometers thick.
23. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 30 micrometers thick.
24. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 20 micrometers thick.
25. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 15 micrometers thick.
26. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 10 micrometers thick.
27. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer comprises a polymer.
28. The laminate of claim 27, wherein the polymer of the support layer comprises polyethylene terephthalate.
29. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer is less than about 20 mil thick.
30. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer is less than about 15 mil thick.
31. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer is less than about 10 mil thick.
32. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer is less than about 5 mil thick.
33. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the support layer introduces a modulus of greater than 1000 to the laminate.
34. The laminate of claim 3, wherein the layer of perfluoropolyether is coupled with the support layer by photoinitiator coupling and thermalinitiator coupling.
35. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether comprises a photocurable component.
36. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the layer of perfluoropolyether has a footprint greater than about 25 square centimeters.
37. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the layer of perfluoropolyether has a footprint greater than about 50 square centimeters.
38. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the layer of perfluoropolyether has a footprint greater than about 100 square centimeters.
39. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 5 micrometers from an adjacent cavity.
40. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 2 micrometer from an adjacent cavity.
41. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 1 micrometers from an adjacent cavity.
42. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 750 nanometers from an adjacent cavity.
43. The laminate of claim 4, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 500 nanometers from an adjacent cavity.
44. The laminate of claim 1, wherein the perfluoropolyether has less than about 10 percent sol fraction.
45. A method of making a laminate nanomold; comprising:
positioning a patterned master adjacent to a support layer;
inserting the positioned patterned master and adjacent support layer between nips of a roll laminator;
delivering a curable perfluoropolyether between the patterned master and the support layer adjacent an input side of the roll laminator;
activating the roll laminator to laminate the patterned master with the support layer, wherein the curable perfluoropolyether is dispersed between the patterned master and the support layer; and
treating the laminate to activate a curable component of the curable perfluoropolyether such that the perfluoropolyether is solidified.

46. The method of claim 45, further comprising before positioning the patterned master adjacent the support layer, configuring a tie-layer with the support layer such that when activated the curable perfluoropolyether binds with the tie-layer.
47. The method of claim 46, wherein the tie-layer comprises a dual cure material.

48. The method of claim 45, wherein the patterned master includes a plurality of cavities comprising a predetermined shape selected from the group consisting of cylindrical, 200 nm diameter cylinders, cuboidal, 200 nm cuboidal, crescent, and concave disc.
49. The method of claim 48, wherein the plurality of cavities comprise cavities of a variety of predetermined shapes.
50. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 10 micrometers in a largest dimension.
51. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 5 micrometers in a largest dimension.
52. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 1 micrometers in a largest dimension.
53. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 750 nanometers in a largest dimension.
54. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 500 nanometers in a largest dimension.
55. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 300 nanometers in a largest dimension.
56. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 200 nanometers in a largest dimension.
57. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 100 nanometers in a largest dimension.
58. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 75 nanometers in a largest dimension.
59. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 50 nanometers in a largest dimension.
60. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 40 nanometers in a largest dimension.
61. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 30 nanometers in a largest dimension.
62. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 20 nanometers in a largest dimension.
63. The method of claim 48, wherein each cavity of the plurality of cavities is less than about 10 nanometers in a largest dimension.
64. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 50 micrometers thick.
65. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 40 micrometers thick.
66. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 30 micrometers thick.
67. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 20 micrometers thick.
68. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 15 micrometers thick.
69. The method of claim 45, wherein the perfluoropolyether layer is less than about 10 micrometers thick.
70. The method of claim 45, wherein the support layer comprises a polymer.
71. The method of claim 70, wherein the polymer of the support layer comprises polyethylene terephthalate.
72. A laminate polymer mold, comprising:
a first polymer layer;
a second polymer layer; and
a tie-layer disposed between the first polymer layer and the second polymer layer, wherein the tie-layer comprises a dual cure fluoropolymer.
73. The laminate polymer mold of claim 72, wherein the polymer of the first or second layers includes a fluoropolymer.
74. The laminate polymer mold of claim 73, wherein the polymer of the first or second layers includes a perfluoropolyether.
75. The laminate polymer mold of claim 72, wherein the polymer of the first or second layers includes a polyethylene terephthalate.
76. The laminate polymer mold of claim 72, wherein the fluoropolymer of the tie-layer includes a perfluoropolyether.
